�ӿ� JHeaderChecksum

  • ������֪ʵ����:
    Ethernet, GRE, Icmp, Ip4, Sctp, Tcp, Udp

    public interface JHeaderChecksum
    Interface implemented by protocol headers that maintain a header and possibly payload checksums.
    ����:
    Sly Technologies, Inc.

    • ������Ҫ

      ���з��� ʵ������ ���󷽷� 
      �޶��������� ������˵��
      int calculateChecksum()
      Calculates a checksum using protocol specification for a header.
      int checksum()
      Retrieves the header's checksum.
      boolean checksum(int crc)
      Setter method to set a new checksum on the header.
      boolean isChecksumValid()
      Validates the header's data against the stored checksum.

    • ������ϸ����

      • calculateChecksum

        int calculateChecksum()
        Calculates a checksum using protocol specification for a header. Checksums for partial headers or fragmented packets (unless the protocol allows it) are not calculated.
        ����:
        header's calculated checksum

      • checksum

        int checksum()
        Retrieves the header's checksum.
        ����:
        header's stored checksum

      • checksum

        boolean checksum(int crc)
        Setter method to set a new checksum on the header.
        ����:
        crc - new value of the header. Can be 8, 16 or 32-bit checksum, even if in signed form.
        ����:
        true if setter succeeded, or false if unable to set the checksum such as when its the case when header is truncated or not complete

      • isChecksumValid

        boolean isChecksumValid()
        Validates the header's data against the stored checksum. Checksums for partial headers or fragmented packets (unless the protocol allows it) are not validated and true is always returned.
        ����:
        Calculates a checksum and validates it against the store checksum in the header. If checksums match or header is a fragment true is returned, otherwise if the checksums don't match false is returned.

      • recalculateChecksum

        boolean recalculateChecksum()
        Method which recomputes the checksum and sets the new computed value in checksum field.
        ����:
        true if setter succeeded, or false if unable to set the checksum such as when its the case when header is truncated or not complete
        �����°汾��ʼ:
        1.4
